bill.title: Cannabis.
bill.abstract: Sections 27, 101, 2525, 26001, 26051.5, 26067, 26068, 26070, 26161, and 26211 of of, and to amend the heading of Chapter 7 (commencing with Section 26070) of Division 10 of, the Business and Professions Code, relating to cannabis.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING CHILD CARE LICENSING, CERTAIN MUNICIPAL PENSION DEFICIT FUNDING BONDS, RECIPROCAL LICENSING OF ITINERANT FOOD VENDING ESTABLISHMENTS, FUNCTIONS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF REHABILITATION SERVICES, BUSINESS DEDUCTIONS AND TAXATION OF CERTAIN WAGES AND INCOME, ORAL HEALTH ASSESSMENTS ...
bill.abstract: To require the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management to analyze the administrative costs of collecting state taxes and make recommendations for the elimination of any state tax for which the administrative costs for collection are greater than the revenue such tax generates.

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE JUVENILE JUSTICE POLICY AND OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE AND CONCERNING THE TRANSFER OF JUVENILE SERVICES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES TO THE COURT SUPPORT SERVICES DIVISION OF THE JUDICIAL BRANCH.
bill.abstract: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE SEWAGE SPILL RIGHT-TO-KNOW ACT AND EXPANDING CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR WASTEWATER OPERATORS.
bill.abstract: To establish a time frame and additional methodology for the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to notify the public of unanticipated sewage spills and to require continuing education requirements for wastewater treatment facility operators.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TAX IMPOSED ON AMBULATORY SURGICAL CENTERS AND ANNUAL ADJUSTMENTS TO ASSESSMENT RATES ADOPTED FOR CERTAIN UNITS OF COMMON INTEREST COMMUNITIES AND CONDOMINIUMS UNDER COMMON OWNERSHIP.
bill.abstract: To implement the recommendations of the Department of Developmental Services regarding waiver of licensing fees for private providers.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING VARIOUS REVISIONS TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To implement the Department of Public Health's recommendations regarding various revisions to the public health statutes.

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: AN ACT IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE OFFICE OF EARLY CHILDHOOD.
bill.abstract: To implement the recommendations of the Office of Early Childhood.

bill.title: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH FROM MAKING RESCISSIONS OR OTHER REDUCTIONS TO THE EDUCATION COST SHARING GRANT DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.
bill.abstract: To prohibit the Governor from making rescissions to a town's education cost sharing grant during the fiscal year.

status.standardval: Vetoed or sent back to legislature with amendments.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CONNECTICUT LIFE AND HEALTH INSURANCE GUARANTY ASSOCIATION.
bill.abstract: To (1) incorporate revisions made by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners to its Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Model Act into the Connecticut Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act, and (2) make other changes to the Connecticut Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING INSURANCE ISSUES.
bill.abstract: To (1) authorize the Insurance Commissioner to adopt regulations concerning electronic filing, (2) modify the approval process for proposed domestic insurers, (3) subject fraternal benefit societies to certain requirements of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners' Valuation Manual, (4) authorize the commissioner to prescribe nonforfeiture benefits for contingent deferred annuities, (5) clarify statutory provisions concerning filing fees charged to fraternal benefit societies, (6) specify that both present and former officers of an insurer must cooperate with investigations conducted by the commissioner, (7) modify the duties of insurance agents, and (8) repeal a provision concerning delinquency proceedings.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING MAMMOGRAMS, BREAST ULTRASOUNDS AND MAGNETIC RESONANCE IMAGING OF BREASTS.
bill.abstract: To (1) redefine mammogram, and (2) eliminate copayments and deductibles for certain breast ultrasounds.

bill.title: AN ACT IMPOSING A SURCHARGE ON CERTAIN INSURANCE POLICIES AND ESTABLISHING THE HEALTHY HOMES FUND.
bill.abstract: To require insurers that file a rate increase of twenty per cent or more for an individual or a group long-term care insurance policy to spread such increase over not less than five years.

bill.title: AN ACT MANDATING INSURANCE COVERAGE OF ESSENTIAL HEALTH BENEFITS AND EXPANDING MANDATED HEALTH BENEFITS FOR WOMEN, CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS.
bill.abstract: To (1) mandate insurance coverage of essential health benefits, (2) expand mandated health benefits for women, children and adolescents, and (3) expand mandated contraception benefits.

profile.pname: Astellas|Company Issues|Step Therapy and Fail First

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING PHARMACIST AND PRACTITIONER COMPLIANCE RATES AND THE ELECTRONIC PRESCRIPTION DRUG MONITORING PROGRAM.
bill.abstract: To reduce the number of deaths related to opioid drug prescriptions.

bill.title: AN ACT EXPANDING ACCESS TO THE MONEY FOLLOWS THE PERSON DEMONSTRATION PROJECT AND REPEALING OBSOLETE STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To expand access to the Money Follows the Person demonstration project and repeal obsolete statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE OFFICE OF HEALTH STRATEGY.
bill.abstract: To make the statutory changes necessary to implement the establishment of the Office of Health Strategy.

status.statusval: Transmitted to the Secretary of State

bill.title: AN ACT REQUIRING THE CONSIDERATION OF CREATING A PORTFOLIO STANDARD FOR THERMAL ENERGY IN THE NEXT INTEGRATED RESOURCES PLAN.
bill.abstract: To change the definition of Class I renewable energy source to include certain useful thermal energy generated from biodiesel and to create a homeowner-generated useful thermal energy program.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO CERTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND CONSERVATION PROGRAMS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND CERTAIN FARMLAND PRESERVATION PROGRAMS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND ESTABLISHING A WORKING GROUP ON MICROFIBER POLLUTION, AUTHORIZING SCHOOL ...
bill.abstract: To authorize the inclusion of grass clippings for certain leaf composting facilities without solid waste permits and to provide for better tracking of fallow deer populations.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING PRESCRIPTION DRUG COSTS.
bill.abstract: To impose additional disclosure and reporting requirements on pharmacy benefits managers, health carriers, pharmaceutical manufacturers, the Office of Health Strategy and the Insurance Department concerning prescription drug rebates and the cost of prescription drugs.

Astellas|Healthcare General|Change in Reimbursement for Medicaid
Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING CONNECTICUT CREDIT UNIONS.
bill.abstract: To: (1) Allow Connecticut credit unions to, without prior approval from the Commissioner of Banking, engage in any activity that a federal credit union or out-of-state credit union may be authorized to engage in under state or federal law; (2) require the Commissioner of Banking to report certain information; (3) change the requirements for reviewing policies adopted by the governing board of a Connecticut credit union; (4) allow Connecticut credit unions to provide electronic notices of certain meetings; (5) allow members of a Connecticut credit union to vote by electronic means; and (6) expand the area of operation and services of Connecticut credit unions.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING MINOR AND TECHNICAL CHANGES TO THE TAX AND RELATED STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To make minor and technical changes to the tax and related statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO THE STUDENT DATA PRIVACY ACT.
bill.abstract: To create a uniform student data privacy terms-of-service agreement addendum for use in contracts, to require a one-time annual notice relating to contracts entered into by the board of education, to require the Department of Education to provide written guidance on the laws relating to student data privacy, to authorize the retention of student records required by state and federal law and for purposes of disaster recovery systems, to allow the use of certain web sites and mobile applications that do not comply with the law if specified in a child's IEP, and to add the executive director of the Connecticut Association of Schools to the membership of the student data privacy task force.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING MINOR REVISIONS AND ADDITIONS TO THE EDUCATION STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To make minor revisions to the education statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE AUDITORS OF PUBLIC ACCOUNTS CONCERNING PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF SPECIAL EDUCATION.
bill.abstract: To require that boards of education enter into contracts with private providers of special education and to clarify that individualized education programs are not considered contracts, and to require the Commissioner of Education to establish a rates schedule for the provision of special education by private providers of special education services.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE TASK FORCE ON LIFE-THREATENING FOOD ALLERGIES IN SCHOOLS.
bill.abstract: To implement the recommendations of the task force on life-threatening food allergies in schools.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING NINETY-DAY PERMIT TURNAROUND TIMES FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.
bill.abstract: To modify and clarify certain ninety-day turnaround times for permits issued by the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING MINIMUM EMPLOYEE WAGES FOR PROVIDERS OF STATE-ADMINISTERED SERVICES FOR PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES.
bill.abstract: To require providers of state-contracted human services to pay employees a minimum of fifteen dollars an hour within available state appropriations.

status.statusval: Transmitted by Secretary of the State to Governor

profile.pname: Heineken|General|Labor and workplace issues (operational and significant)

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING CONSUMER CREDIT LICENSES.
bill.abstract: To (1) centralize certain Banking Commissioner authorities existing in mortgage and nonmortgage licensing provisions, (2) make such authorities applicable to mortgage and nonmortgage entities that obtain licenses through the Nationwide Multistate Licensing System and Registry, and (3) reduce redundancy in the banking statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING EXECUTIVE BRANCH AGENCY DATA MANAGEMENT AND PROCESSES, THE TRANSMITTAL OF TOWN PROPERTY ASSESSMENT INFORMATION AND THE SUSPENSION OF CERTAIN REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS.
bill.abstract: To increase access to data by executive branch agencies by codifying the provisions of Executive Order 39, to create a Connecticut Board of Data Analysis Technology Advisory Board, to require the Office of Policy and Management to establish and oversee a state-wide process improvement initiative, to require towns to transmit certain property assessment information to their regional council of governments or the Office of Policy and Management and to permit state agencies to suspend regulatory requirements for paper or facsimile submission of documents or data.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING ROBO CALLS AND SPOOFING.
bill.abstract: To criminalize the act of masking the identity of a caller initiating robo calls.

bill.title: AN ACT AUTHORIZING AND ADJUSTING BONDS OF THE STATE FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER PURPOSES, CONCERNING THE BOND CAPS, ESTABLISHING THE APPRENTICESHIP CONNECTICUT INITIATIVE AND CONCERNING THE FUNCTIONS OF CTNEXT AND CONNECTICUT INNOVATIONS, INCORPORATED.
bill.abstract: To delay the inclusion of certain bond covenants for bonds issued during certain time periods and exclude refunding bonds and temporary borrowings from the calculation of the bond issuance cap.

sponsor.name: Higher Education and Employment Advancement Committee

bill.title: AN ACT ASSISTING STUDENTS WITHOUT LEGAL IMMIGRATION STATUS WITH THE COST OF COLLEGE.
bill.abstract: To require the Office of Higher Education to study issues relating to higher education in the state.

status.statusval: Transmitted to the Secretary of State

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING CLIMATE CHANGE PLANNING AND RESILIENCY.
bill.abstract: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING CONNECTICUT'S ENERGY FUTURE.
bill.abstract: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING AN AFFECTED BUSINESS ENTITY TAX, VARIOUS PROVISIONS RELATED TO CERTAIN BUSINESS DEDUCTIONS, THE ESTATE AND GIFT TAX IMPOSITION THRESHOLDS, THE TAX TREATMENT OF CERTAIN WAGES AND INCOME AND A STUDY TO IDENTIFY BEST PRACTICES FOR MARKETING THE BENEFITS OF QUALIFIED OPPORTUNITY ZONES.
bill.abstract: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO DEPARTMENT OF CONSUMER PROTECTION STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To make minor changes to multiple Department of Consumer Protection related statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING CHANGES TO PHARMACY AND DRUG CONTROL STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To make changes to various pharmacy and drug control statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT EXTENDING THE HOURS OF OPERATION OF AIRPORT AIRLINE CLUB ALCOHOLIC LIQUOR PERMITTEES.
bill.abstract: To extend the hours of operation of airport airline club alcoholic liquor permittees.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING BIOLOGICAL PRODUCTS.
bill.abstract: To add biological products to existing law regarding substitution of generic drugs.

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: AN ACT AUTHORIZING PREGNANCY AS A QUALIFYING EVENT FOR SPECIAL ENROLLMENT PERIODS FOR CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS.
bill.abstract: To permit certain pregnant individuals to enroll in a health insurance policy or plan not later than thirty days after the individual's pregnancy has been certified by a licensed health care provider.

status.statusval: Became Law, Not Signed by the Governor
status.standardval: Final adoption. Signed by governor or veto overridden or no signature needed

bill.title: AN ACT REQUIRING THE HEALTH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY OFFICER TO ESTABLISH A WORKING GROUP TO EVALUATE ISSUES CONCERNING POLYPHARMACY AND MEDICATION RECONCILIATION.
bill.abstract: To require the Health Information Technology Officer to establish a working group concerning polypharmacy and medication reconciliation.

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING AUDITS OF MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS.
bill.abstract: To clarify documentation requirements for audits of providers of medical assistance.

bill.title: AN ACT LIMITING AUTO REFILLS OF PRESCRIPTION DRUGS COVERED UNDER THE MEDICAID PROGRAM AND REQUIRING THE COMMISSIONER OF SOCIAL SERVICES TO PROVIDE CHIP DATA TO THE HEALTH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY OFFICER.
bill.abstract: To prevent unnecessary costs and clinical outcomes associated with prescriptions that are unnecessarily automatically refilled.

bill.title: AN ACT EXTENDING THE MANUFACTURING APPRENTICESHIP TAX CREDIT TO PASS-THROUGH ENTITIES.
bill.abstract: To allow certain business entities to claim the manufacturing apprenticeship tax credit against the personal income tax.

status.standardval: Vetoed or sent back to legislature with amendments.

bill.title: AN ACT ELIMINATING CERTAIN UNCLAIMED AND SELDOM CLAIMED TAX CREDITS.
bill.abstract: To eliminate the enterprise zone tax credit for qualifying corporations, the service facility tax credit and the manufacturing facility tax credit for facilities located in an enterprise zone.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING INCENTIVES TO ENCOURAGE THE GROWTH OF BIOSCIENCE VENTURE CAPITAL IN CONNECTICUT.
bill.abstract: To exempt from the personal income tax certain income received by general partners of venture capital firms.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING TECHNICAL REVISIONS TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To make technical revisions to certain public health statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING TELEHEALTH SERVICES.
bill.abstract: To add providers who can administer telehealth services and to modify and clarify patient consent procedures.

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING OUTPATIENT CLINICS, URGENT CARE CENTERS AND FREESTANDING EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS.
bill.abstract: To protect patients from unexpected costs and fees.

sponsor.name: Higher Education and Employment Advancement Committee

bill.title: AN ACT EXTENDING THE MORATORIUM ON APPROVAL OF A CERTAIN NUMBER OF PROGRAMS OF INDEPENDENT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION.
bill.abstract: To extend the sunset on the moratorium for private institutions of higher education to obtain the approval of the Office of Higher Education for new or modified programs.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' RECOMMENDATIONS FOR TECHNICAL AND OTHER CHANGES TO THE INSURANCE STATUTES.
bill.abstract: To make technical, conforming and minor changes to the insurance statutes.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR PROSTHETIC DEVICES.
bill.abstract: To require health insurance coverage for certain prosthetic devices.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE SERVICES' RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING STATE TAXATION AND COLLECTION.
bill.abstract: To implement the Department of Revenue Services' recommendations regarding state taxation and collection.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING SECURITY FREEZES ON CREDIT REPORTS, IDENTITY THEFT PREVENTION SERVICES AND REGULATIONS OF CREDIT RATING AGENCIES.
bill.abstract: To (1) prohibit credit rating agencies from charging a fee to consumers to place or remove a security freeze from the consumer's account, (2) require credit rating agencies to notify other credit rating agencies of a consumer's request to place or remove a security freeze from such consumer's account, and (3) increase the amount of identity theft prevention or mitigation services provided after a security breach.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OF OPIOID DEPENDENCY AND OPIOID OVERDOSES IN THE STATE.
bill.abstract: To require the Chief Court Administrator, in consultation with the Chief Public Defender, Chief State's Attorney and the dean of The University of Connecticut School of Law, to study the feasibility of establishing one or more opioid intervention courts in the state.

bill.title: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO THE STATE BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2019 AND DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018.

status.statusval: Transmitted to the Secretary of State

bill.title: Infant and Toddler Developmental Health Services Act of 2017 (now known as ""Birth-to-Three for All DC Act of 2018"")

profile.pname: Astellas|Healthcare General|Change in Reimbursement for Medicaid

sponsor.name: Chairman Mendelson at the request of the Mayor

bill.title: Fiscal Year 2019 Local Budget Act of 2018

status.statusval: Transmitted to Congress, Projected Law Date is Sep 27, 2018

bill.title: Credit Protection Fee Waiver Emergency Declaration Resolution of 2018
An Act relative to surety bonds
bill.abstract: Amends various provisions regulating financial institutions in the commonwealth; allows debt collectors licensed under GL 93:24 - GL 93:28; to submit acceptable bond documentation to the state treasurer instead of an actual bond; requires bonds or acceptable bond documentation accepted by the commissioner of banks to be accessible to the state treasurer; requires the state treasurer to make records of bonds or bond documentation accessible to the public; repeals provisions requiring inclusion of the listed information, including the names, places of residence and places of business of the principals and sureties; permits banks, banking associations or loan associations engaged in issuing checks or money orders (GL 167F) and companies engaged in accepting deposits for transmission to ...

bill.title: An Act ensuring appropriate allotment of risk
bill.abstract: Submits several technical changes relative to the assumption of risk by insurance companies that provide health care benefits; amends approval of health insurance policies and base rate changes under GL 176J:6; changes standards for exceptions to the presumed disapproval of proposed rate changes for carriers whose risk based capital ratio is greater than 600 percent for the most recent 4 consecutive quarters, if the reported contribution to surplus does not exceed 0.5 percent; changes standards for exceptions to the presumed disapproval of proposed rate changes for carriers whose risk based capital ratio is greater than 700 per cent for the most recent 4 consecutive quarters, if the reported contribution to surplus does not exceed 0 percent; amends annual comprehensive financial statements ...

bill.title: An Act relative to ensuring transparency of health plan formularies
bill.abstract: This bill sets forth parallel provisions relative to transparency in the development of drug formularies to a number of different chapters dealing with various kinds of health insurance. (A drug formulary is a list of prescription drugs, both generic and brand name, used by practitioners to identify drugs that offer the greatest overall value, which is normally maintained by a committee of physicians, nurse practitioners, and pharmacists.) Specifically, the provisions require that every health insurance provider post the formulary for the health plan on the carrier\'s web site in a manner that is accessible and searchable by enrollees, potential enrollees, and providers; update the formulary within 24 hours of making changes; and include an enumerated set of information, especially ...

bill.title: An Act relative to transparency and access in healthcare
bill.abstract: Enacts two new chapters into the General Laws: a new Chapter 111P (Transparency by Drug Manufacturers) and a new Chapter 175M (Transparency by Pharmacy Benefit Managers). Additional provisions involve drug formularies, and what health insurers must disclose.The new Chapter 111P establishes a kind of \'manufacturing transparency\' under which each manufacturer of a prescription drug that has experienced a wholesale acquisition cost increase of 15% or more over a 12 month period, must file a report with the Department of Public Health that includes an enumerated set of facts and disclosures. These forms must be filed no later than 90 days after the effective date of the most recent wholesale acquisition cost increase. The Department in turn is required to keep trade secrets or other ...

profile.pname: Astellas|Company Issues|Step Therapy and Fail First
Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act to reduce health care costs through improved medication management
bill.abstract: ...These provisions are set forth in parallel to apply to Indemnity Plans (GL 175), Non-profit Hospital Service Corporations (GL 176A), Medical Service Corporations (GL 176B), and Health Maintenance Organizations (GL 176G). The bill does not apply these requirements to the Group Insurance Commission (GL 32A) or Medicaid (GL 118E).

profile.pname: Astellas|Company Issues|Step Therapy and Fail First

bill.title: An Act amending the banking laws and related statutes
bill.abstract: This bill makes several changes to various banking laws that relate to issues of conversion of a cooperative bank, savings bank or trust company to an LLC, deposit of county and municipal funds, the regulation of high cost mortgage loans, the investment of public funds, and the savings promotion raffle.In particular, the bill establishes that the kind of banking institution in which a public instrumentality, including a city or town may deposit money includes any Commonwealth banking institution so long as the funds are redeposited in accounts in one or more banks or savings and loan associations, and the full amount of each such deposit is FDIC insured; establishes that cities, towns, counties, and even the MassTech Investment Fund can deposit funds into a savings banks, co-operative ...

bill.title: An Act relative to providing consumer protection in the licensing of appraisers
bill.abstract: Amends GL 26:8G, (Auto Damage Appraiser Licensing Board), to increase the size of the board by 3 members, from 4 to 7; gives the Attorney General the authority to appoint two board members and the Commissioner of Insurance one member; establishes the qualifications and terms of the members.

profile.pname: Heineken|General|Labor and workplace issues (operational and significant)

bill.title: An Act relative to patient financial protection
bill.abstract: Requires that any health insurance policy issued in the Commonwealth that provides coverage for prescription drugs also establish a separate out-of-pocket limit for prescription drugs, including specialty drugs. The out-of-pocket limit may not exceed the dollar amount set as the minimum annual deductible for a high deductible health plan 26 U.S.C. section 223 (c)(2)(A)(i), for self-only and family coverage, respectively. The out-of-pocket limit includes expenses that are a cost-sharing expenditure under section 1302 of the federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (\'Obamacare\') and that relate to prescription drug coverage. The same parallel provisions are then applied to GL 176A (Hospital Service Corporations), 176B (Medical Service Corporations), and 176G (Health Maintenance ...

bill.title: An Act relative to consumer protection following a bankruptcy
bill.abstract: Adds new section 68F to GL Chapter 93 to establish an affirmative duty for financial institutions to report continuing payments from debtors that have filed for bankruptcy if the account was reaffirmed by a judge. If the account was not reaffirmed then the institution should report the number of months since the filing for bankruptcy and the number of payments made on the liability by the consumer during that period of time. Any institution that fails to comply with this section will be subject to claims for compensatory and punitive damages by consumers. (Purports to insert section 68F after section 54A despite the existence of sections 54B through 68E).

bill.title: An Act to promote value-based insurance design in the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Inserts new provisions in GL c.6A (Executive Offices) that require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to determine which medical and behavioral health services, treatments and prescription drugs will be deemed \'high-value cost-effective services.\' A Value-Based Insurance Expert Panel will advise EOHHS in making this determination. In addition, various health insurance plans must cover, without cost-sharing, for all medical and behavioral services, treatments and prescription drugs determined to be high-value cost-effective services. These requirements are set forth in parallel to the Group Insurance Commission (GL 32A), Medicaid (GL 118E), Indemnity Plans (GL 175), Non-profit Hospital Service Corporations (GL 176A), Medical Service Corporations (GL 176B), Health Maintenance ...

bill.title: An Act relative to uncollected co-pays, co-insurance and deductibles
bill.abstract: Establishes a new GL 176O:7A, requiring insurers that provide health care benefits to reimburse health care providers at least 65 percent of co-payments, co-insurance and/or deductibles which remain unpaid after reasonable collection efforts; defines the uncollected co-payments, co-insurance and/or deductibles as bad debt when it is calculated in accordance with a health benefit plan, when is is at least $250, when the claim results from a unique service, and when it remains unpaid for at least 120 days from the date the bill was initially mailed; requires health care providers to submit requests for reimbursement in the aggregate by May 1 of each year; authorizes carriers to audit requests for reimbursement; requires the division of insurance to establish regulations consistent with those ...

bill.title: An Act relative to insurance co-pays
bill.abstract: Prohibits all health insurance plans from requiring a co-pay for any regular preventative screening or testing required by a physician. (No general or session laws cited).

bill.title: An Act to ensure access to generic medications
bill.abstract: Establishes a new GL 176D:3C, to regulate pharmaceutical drugs, medical products or devices placed on a \maximum allowable cost list\, which imposes a maximum reimbursement rate for pharmacies; requires all drugs placed on a maximum allowable cost list to have at least two therapeutically equivalent, multiple source drugs, or at least one generic drug available; requires removing drugs from the list if they no longer have alternatives; regulate disclosure of list contents and appeals of maximum allowable costs by pharmacies; requires pharmacy benefit managers or other covered entities to increase the maximum allowable cost for all pharmacies if an appeal is successful; requires appeals process information to be available on a secure company website, and to include a phone number for ...

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act for health care non-discrimination
bill.abstract: Adds a new section to GL Chapter 176O (Health Insurance Consumer Protections); specifies what metrics may and may not be used in determining alternative payment arrangements; permits the use of age, acuity, social determinants of health, and behavioral health needs, while prohibiting the use of historic price trends among categories of users or use of particular providers; requires disclosure of data used in pricing determinations to CHIA; establishes that use of prohibited data or failure to disclose data is an unfair business practice under GL 93A; adds definition of alternative payment arrangement.

bill.title: An Act to facilitate alternatives to foreclosure
bill.abstract: ...Foreclosure and Redemption of Mortgages) by adding a new 35D relative to remediating foreclosures. In particular, the bill establishes a Massachusetts Foreclosure Mediation Program administered by the Massachusetts Office of Public Collaboration at UMass Boston, and requires the program\'s involvement as a precondition for foreclosure; the bill further details the mediation processes and a $50 surcharge on the filing fee for foreclosure complaints filed under the Service Members Civil Relief Act.

bill.title: An Act relative to anesthesia coverage for children hospitalized for dental treatment
bill.abstract: Requires health care plans to provide coverage for anesthesia and outpatient treatment for dental care for children with disabilities, certain medical conditions, and all children under the age of six.

bill.title: An Act alleviating health care burdens for Massachusetts employers
bill.abstract: This bill appears to do two primary things: first, to move the existing mandate for individual coverage in the GL c.176J on Small Group Health Insurance to GL c.176M on Nongroup Health Insurance; and second, to create greater compliance between the individual mandate in the Commonwealth and the requirements of the federal Affordable Care Act. In particular, the bill requires every carrier to make an individual certificate available to any person who has health insurance coverage, so as to comply with the ACA. Requires every carrier to enroll a person who seeks to enroll in a health benefit plan, and to do so within 63 days of termination of any prior creditable coverage; prohibits a carrier from imposing a pre-existing condition exclusion or waiting period of any duration on a health plan; ...

bill.title: An Act to ban hospital facility fees and surprise billing

profile.pname: Astellas|Healthcare General|Change in Reimbursement for Medicaid

bill.title: An Act to improve health care costs for employers and consumers
bill.abstract: Establishes a framework for the acceptance of health insurance coverage by health care providers between now and December 31, 2023 under a new GL 176O:28; prohibits health care providers from billing patients for amounts not covered by health insurance payments other than co-payments, co-insurance and deductibles; prohibits health insurers from making payments to certain health care providers that exceed the standard rate; establishes a formula for calculation of payment rates for health care services equal to the 80th percentile within one of four geographic regions; establishes a timeframe for reaching the 80th percentile for providers in the 90th or 85th percentiles; requires health care providers who opt out of insurance coverage networks to charge a rate equal to the carrier-specific ...

bill.title: An Act relative to osteoporosis screening and treatment to prevent fractures and reduce health care costs
bill.abstract: Requires the use of clinical assessments, medical history and physical examination to screen post-menopausal women 50 years of age and above for osteoporosis and fracture risk; requires the use of bone mineral density testing for osteoporosis screening of post-menopausal women age 60 or over, men age 70 or older and younger men and women at increased risk for bone loss and fracture; requires the contributory group health insurance program for public employees, the division of medical assistance, health insurance policies, non-profit hospital service corporations, medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for bone mineral density testing, to diagnose and determine the degree of osteoporosis, and treatment for post-menopausal women diagnosed with ...

bill.title: An Act establishing a student loan bill of rights
bill.abstract: Student Loan Ombudsman within the Division of Banks, to provide timely assistance to any student loan borrower who has a student education loan. The Ombudsman is to receive, review and assist in resolving complaints from student loan borrowers, including attempts to resolve such complaints in collaboration with institutions of higher education, student loan servicers, and any other participants in student loan lending.The bill further establishes that no person or entity (other than an institution already registered with the Commissioner of Banks) may act as a student loan servicer, directly or indirectly, without first obtaining a license. A student loan servicer will be prohibited from employing any scheme, device or artifice to defraud or mislead student loan borrowers; engage in any ...

bill.title: An Act relative to access to vital healthcare information
bill.abstract: Amends GL 176O:27 relative to summary of payments form in health insurance consumer protections, by rewriting the section completely. As rewritten, the section provides that the Division of Insurance develop a common summary of payments form to be used by all carriers providing health insurance. Carriers must permit an insured who is legally authorized to consent to care to choose his or her preferred method of receiving the common summary; unless specifically requested by the insured, the carrier will not provide a common summary of payments form if the insured has no liability for payment for any procedure or service; carriers must permit all insureds to request suppression of summary of payments forms; and, the right to request suppression of summary of payments forms must be ...

bill.title: An Act relative to rebate law reform
bill.abstract: Amends GL 175:182, prohibiting gifts, rewards or other consideration that incentivize entering into an insurance, annuity or endowment contract; amends GL 176D:3, prohibiting premium rebates on contracts for life insurance, life annuity or accident and health insurance; exempts prizes, goods, wares, gift cards, gift certificates, event tickets, merchandise and other items up to $100.00 in value per customer or prospective customer in any one calendar year from the prohibitions.

bill.title: An Act relative to patient choice to promote prescription safety
bill.abstract: Amends provisions of the Controlled Substances Act (GL c.94C) to make it mandatory, rather than permissive, for a registered pharmacist to fill less than the prescribed amounts of opioids, if that is requested by the patient. In addition, makes technical changes to GL 94C:18 (Issuance of prescription by practitioner or physician) relative to harmonizing the state statute with federal law.Also, amends provisions of General Law to establish that an insurance policy must provide, for any covered drug that is a narcotic substance contained in Schedule II that is subject to cost sharing, a schedule that allows for adjustments and reductions in the cost sharing when a person requests a prescription filled in a lesser quantity. These provisions are set forth in parallel relative to Indemnity ...

bill.title: An Act relative to substance use disorder diversion and treatment
bill.abstract: Submits comprehensive modifications to GL 111 regulating drug rehabilitation; modifies the definition of drug dependent person to include persons of any age, to include alcohol and to include people at risk of becoming drug dependent; requires the Division of Drug Rehabilitation to compile a list of drug rehabilitation facilities if unable to establish an independent comprehensive program for the treatment of drug dependent persons; requires addiction specialists, not psychiatrists or physicians, to examine people seeking admission to drug rehabilitation facilities; repeals provisions requiring consideration of any prior treatment before admission; makes significant changes to many sections of GL 111:10 regulating the examination of defendants charged with drug offenses; entitles ...

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act relative to insurance companies and quality measures
bill.abstract: Amends GL 32A:2 and 32A:21 to require that any contract between an insurance carrier and the Group Insurance Commission for a physician performance evaluation program must include certain articulated quality requirements and that insurance carriers\' physician performance evaluation programs also include those requirements; and lists among those minimum requirements (1) advance disclosure of the methodologies, criteria and algorithms under consideration, meaningful input by independent practicing physicians and biostatisticians, (2) a mechanism to ensure data accuracy and validity that includes a feedback cycle of not less than 120 days prior to the public reporting of the data, which accepts corrections to errors from multiple sources, including the physician being evaluated, assesses the ...

bill.title: An Act relative to shoppable health care services
An Act to ensure access to generic medications
bill.abstract: Establishes a new GL 176D:3C, to regulate pharmaceutical drugs, medical products or devices placed on a \maximum allowable cost list\, which imposes a maximum reimbursement rate for pharmacies; requires all drugs placed on a maximum allowable cost list to have at least two therapeutically equivalent, multiple source drugs, or at least one generic drug available; requires removing drugs from the list if they no longer have alternatives; regulate disclosure of list contents and appeals of maximum allowable costs by pharmacies; requires pharmacy benefit managers or other covered entities to increase the maximum allowable cost for all pharmacies if an appeal is successful; requires appeals process information to be available on a secure company website, and to include a phone number for ...

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act relative to the regulation of the business of domestic and foreign money transmission by the Division of Banks
bill.abstract: This lengthy bill rewrites the entirety of GL 169 (Receipts of Deposits for Transmittal to Foreign Countries) from scratch. The rewritten chapter offers a completely new set of definitions -- the existing chapter actually has no definitions -- and subsequently prohibits any person or entity from engaging in the business of money transmission without first obtaining a license from the Commissioner of Banks, with exceptions made for the federal government, a State or a governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality, or certain chartered banks. The bill goes on to further detail the requirements for getting a license from the DOB. The bill further requires that all money received for transmission by any licensee be forwarded to the person to whom the same is directed within 7 days ...

bill.title: An Act establishing uniform confidentiality and enforcement provisions relative to certain licensees under the jurisdiction of the Division of Banks
bill.abstract: This substantial 43 section bill is intended to establish uniform confidentiality and enforcement provisions relative to certain licensees under the jurisdiction of the Division of Banks. These licensees include check cashers & money order agents, institutions engaging in foreign deposit transmissions, insurance premium finance agencies, mortgage lenders, institutions engaging in motor vehicle installment sales or retail installment sales and services, institutions engaging in small loans business, and third party loan servicers.For all of these kinds of institutions the bill enacts relatively parallel provisions, to establish, for example, that each day that a license violation occurs or continues will be deemed to be a separate offense; that the Commissioner of Banks has the power to ...

bill.title: An Act relative to the licensing and supervision of finance companies by the Division of Banks
bill.abstract: This substantial 29 page bill, is intended to improve the licensing and supervision of finance companies by the Division of Banks, especially those involved with motor vehicle installment sales. To begin with, the bill repeals and reenacts the entirety of GL c. 255B, relative to retail installment sales of motor vehicles. As re-enacted, the new chapter clarifies that a consumer loan, means a loan of a principal amount of less than $50,000, and makes definitions consistent with requirements of the federal Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.In particular, the new chapter requires any business engaged in making consumer loans, acting as a motor vehicle sales finance company, or acting as a retail installment sales finance company to be licensed by the Commissioner of ...

bill.title: An Act relative to retail pharmacy discounts and co-pay assistance
bill.abstract: Eliminates a prior repeal of sections of GL 175H:3, to be effective July 1, 2019, permitting and regulating pharmaceutical manufacturer discounts on biological products or prescription drugs made through pharmacies.

bill.title: An Act relative to uniform fiduciary access to digital assets
bill.abstract: Inserts new Chapter 184C (Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets) to adopt a piece of legislation that is meant to be universally used by all the states in an effort to create uniform standards for the handling of personal digital assets upon the death of an owner of digital assets. This bill aims to explicitly give control of digital assets and access to personal representatives, executors, conservators, trustees, and other fiduciaries in order to fulfill their roles in the administration of an individual\'s estate. Up to this point there has been no legislation explicitly governing assets that may be maintained electronically. (Please note that the definition for digital asset is not given and instead, the definition for custodian is repeated in its place. Digital assets are normally ...

bill.title: An Act to extend coverage for any willing provider to qualify as a mental health professional
bill.abstract: Amends the GL 176O on Health Insurance Consumer Protections to require that a carrier is not to exclude from its network or list of authorized providers any licensed mental health or substance abuse provider located within the geographic coverage area of the health benefit plan if the provider is willing to meet the terms and conditions for participation established by the carrier.

bill.title: An Act relative to insurance company rebates
bill.abstract: Amends provisions of GL 175:182, 175:183, and 176D:3 by amending provisions that prohibit offering gifts or inducements with respect to insurance contracts by allowing those gifts or inducements if they don\'t exceed $25, and by clarifying that \'valuable consideration\' does not include insurance advice or related services.

bill.title: An Act relative to health insurance consumer protections

profile.pname: Astellas|Company Issues|Step Therapy and Fail First

bill.title: An Act promoting consumer choice in health care
bill.abstract: Amends GL c.175 (Insurance) to add new provisions prohibiting insurance companies from denying reimbursement to a licensed athletic trainer, acting with a referral from a physician and acting within the scope of his or her practice, for those covered services the insurer would reimburse another health care provider for. These services may be subject to reasonable deductibles, co-payment and co-insurance amounts, fee or benefit limits, practice parameters, and utilization reviews.

bill.title: An Act establishing the Jimmy Carter Cancer Treatment Access Act
bill.abstract: Requires the contributory health insurance policy for public employees and retirees, the division of medical assistance, health insurance companies, medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations to provide access to drugs for the treatment of stage four, advanced metastatic cancer without requiring the prior failure of other drugs, when such treatment is consistent with best medical practices.

bill.title: An Act relative to prescription drug dispensing schedules
bill.abstract: Requires the contributory health insurance policy for public employees and retirees, the division of medical assistance, health insurance companies, medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations to provide access to prescription medication synchronization if a patient so chooses, including dispensing a partial prescription; continues the dispensing fee for a partial prescription at the full - and not the prorated - amount.

bill.title: An Act relative to dental anesthesia
bill.abstract: Requires the contributory health insurance system for public employees, the division of medical assistance, health insurance companies, non-profit hospital service corporations, medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for general anesthesia administered by a licensed anesthesiologist or certified registered nurse anesthetist for dental procedures performed on a child under the age of 7, on a child under the age of 12 with documented phobias or mental illness with urgent dental needs, or on adults with exceptional medical circumstances or developmental disabilities.

bill.title: An Act relative to increasing consumer access to licensed rehabilitation counselors
bill.abstract: Expands coverage of mental health benefits provided under the contributory health insurance system for public employees, or by health insurance companies, non-profit hospital service corporations, medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations, by repealing coverage limited to licensed alcohol and drug counselor I, and including coverage for licensed rehabilitation counselors.

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act relative to Alzheimer's and related dementias in the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Submits various recommendations relating to the treatment of Alzheimer\'s disease in the commonwealth and the administration of Alzheimer\'s related programs; directs the executive office of health and human services to assess all Alzheimer\'s related state programs and to create and maintain an integrated state plan to overcome it; requires the plan to include implementation steps and priorities based on the results of the assessment; establishes and regulates the membership of an advisory council to provide advice to the executive office on Alzheimer\'s, determine the number of people in the Commonwealth with early-onset Alzheimer\'s, determine the needs of such individuals, regardless of age and provide an annual report which evaluates all state funded efforts in research, clinical care ...

bill.title: An Act for prevention and access to appropriate care and treatment of addiction
bill.abstract: ...This bill is intended to improve the availability of substance use disorder treatment, by expanding the range of medical professionals authorized to perform the evaluation and by requiring that the emergency department affirmatively connect the patient with the appropriate level of care. The bill also permits medical professionals or police officers to authorize the transport of a patient to a substance use treatment facility for emergency assessment and treatment when the patient presents a risk of serious harm due to addiction and the patient will not agree to voluntary treatment. Additionally, the bill increases access to the overdose drug naloxone by guaranteeing that practitioners who prescribe and pharmacists who dispense naloxone in good faith will be protected from criminal or ...

profile.pname: Mylan|General Business Issues|Changes in State Licensing

bill.title: An Act relative to solar power in environmental justice and urban communities
bill.abstract: Establishes a framework for the allocation of solar energy market net metering credits for low-income and Environmental Justice households; defines low-income households under GL 40T, related to publicly assisted affordable housing; defines environmental justice households as those with an annual median household income equal to or less than 65 percent of the statewide median, or whose population is up to 25 percent minority or lacking English language proficiency; allows low-income and environmental justice households to take the same market net metering credits as municipal or governmental entities; allows low-income solar net metering facilities to receive credits, and exempts them from demand side management and renewable energy kilowatt-hour charges; increases aggregate net metering ...

status.statusval: Senate Session SS - 07/19/2018 11:00 AM Gardner Auditorium

bill.title: An Act to increase container recycling in the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Secretary of Environmental Affairs to establish a process for determining the diversion rate and the redemption rate. If, by December 31, 2023, the mean diversion rate for any two year period is found by EOEA to be equal to or greater than the mean redemption rate in the corresponding two year period, then this section is to be repealed automatically.

status.statusval: Senate Session SS - 07/19/2018 11:00 AM Gardner Auditorium

profile.pname: Heineken|General|Trade Practices and License to Operate

bill.title: An Act relative to marijuana-related revenue in the town of Millbury
bill.abstract: Storm Water Improvements Stabilization Fund. If there is no allocation into the Road Infrastructure Stabilization Fund or an allocation of less than 50%, then the amount otherwise allocable to the Road Infrastructure Stabilization Fund is to be allocated, in equal amounts, to the Other Post-Employment Benefits Stabilization Fund, the Unfunded Retirement Liability Stabilization Fund and the Capital Projects Stabilization Fund.

bill.title: An Act promoting net neutrality and consumer protection
bill.abstract: ...New draft of SB 2336. The new language replaces the original proposal banning paid prioritization of internet traffic with business practice disclosures and grades for adherence to net neutrality principles. The changes were made due to concerns with federal pre-emption in this area.

bill.title: Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018
bill.abstract: <p><b>Agriculture and Nutrition Act of 2018 </b></p> <p>This bill (commonly known as the farm bill) reauthorizes through FY2023 and modifies Department of Agriculture (USDA) programs that address:</p> <ul> <li>commodity support, </li> <li> conservation, </li> <li> trade and international food aid, </li> <li> nutrition assistance, </li> <li>farm credit, </li> <li> rural development, </li> <li> research and extension activities,</li> <li> forestry, </li> <li>horticulture, and </li> <li> crop insurance. </li> </ul> <p>The bill modifies agriculture and nutrition policies to: </p> <ul> <li> expand the work requirements and modify the eligibility rules for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP, formerly known as the food stamp program), </li> <li> repeal the Conservation ...

bill.title: Women's Entrepreneurship and Economic Empowerment Act of 2018

status.statusval: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to delay the reduction in Federal medical assistance percentage for Medicaid personal care services furnished without an electronic visit verification system, and for other purposes.
bill.abstract: ...This bill delays by one year (to January 1, 2020) the Medicaid federal matching rate reduction that is scheduled to take effect for states that fail to require an electronic visit verification system for personal care services. The bill also excludes specified services from such verification systemrequirements, including inpatient hospital services and 24-hour residential group home services. </p>

bill.title: Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2019
bill.abstract: <p><b>Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2019</b></p> <p>Provides FY2019 appropriations for the Department of the Interior, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and related agencies. </p> <p>Provides appropriations to Interior for: </p> <ul> <li> the Bureau of Land Management, </li> <li> the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, </li> <li> the National Park Service, </li> <li> the U.S. Geological Survey, </li> <li> the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, </li> <li> the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, </li> <li> the Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement, and </li> <li> the Bureau of Indian Affairs and Bureau of Indian Education. </li> </ul> <p>Provides appropriations to Interior for Departmental Offices, including: ...

bill.title: To assist the Department of Homeland Security in preventing emerging threats from unmanned aircraft and vehicles, and for other purposes.

status.statusval: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure, and Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: To modernize U.S. markets and to promote capital formation, investor confidence, and economic growth, and for other purposes
bill.abstract: <p><b>Encouraging Employee Ownership Act</b> </p> <p>This billrequires the Securities and Exchange Commission to increase, from $5 million to $10 million, the 12-month sales threshold beyond which an issuer is required to provide investors with additional disclosures related to compensatory benefit plans.</p>

status.statusval: Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
